title: 109_hr4900
content: The "Internet Free Speech Protection Act of 2006" excludes internet communications from being treated as public communications. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 was amended to exclude internet communications from being considered public communications, except for specific cases such as communications exceeding $5,000 on another person's website or those made by political party committees. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 was amended to exclude internet communications from being considered public communications, except for specific cases such as communications made by political committees or certain individuals described in section 316. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 was amended to exclude internet communications from certain reporting and disclaimer requirements. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 was amended to exclude internet communications from reporting and disclaimer requirements for independent expenditures and unauthorized advertisements. Individuals can now exclude up to $5,000 annually for internet communications from their aggregate independent expenditures. Individuals can now exclude up to $5,000 annually for internet communications from their aggregate independent expenditures. Expenditures on internet communications are excluded from the threshold for registration of political committees. Section 301(4) of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 is amended to exclude up to $10,000 annually for Internet-related expenses such as Internet access, hosting services, and online discussions. SEC. 5 amends the Federal Election Campaign Act to include online media in the exemption from treatment as expenditures for stories and commentaries. SEC. 6 introduces indexing of certain amounts in the Act. Sec. 325 mandates indexing of specific amounts in the Federal Election Campaign Act related to the exclusion of Internet communications from various thresholds and reporting requirements. The Federal Election Campaign Act mandates indexing of specific amounts related to exclusion of Internet communications from reporting requirements. Increases are only made in odd-numbered years and remain in effect for a 2-year period. The inflation adjustment is based on the percent difference determined under section 315(c)(1)(A) with a base period of 2007. The Federal Election Commission will publish guidelines for individual internet activities under the Federal Election Campaign Act. The amendments made by this Act will take effect upon enactment.
